trans-unit.source: This report contains all System Status Notifications from your TYPO3 installation. Please check the status report for more information.

Extension compatibility7 is loaded. You should check that every third-party extension is natively compatible with this version of TYPO3 and then unload this compatibility extension. As long as this compatibility extension is loaded, you will suffer performance drawbacks

trans-unit.note: This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9

trans-unit.source: The deprecation log file was successfully deleted.
trans-unit.note: This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9
This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9

trans-unit.source: The deprecation log file could not be deleted!
trans-unit.note: This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9

trans-unit.source: The deprecation log tracks whether old APIs are being used in extensions. Depending on the extensions you use and whether they use deprecated APIs it can happen that the log takes up quite some space over time. The more space it takes up, the more it may affect your installation's performance. It is recommended to disable deprecation log in production environments.
trans-unit.note: This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9

trans-unit.source: You can find the deprecation log file at %s.
trans-unit.note: This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9

trans-unit.source: Your deprecation log file currently takes up %s.
trans-unit.note: This label is deprecated (not used anymore) since TYPO3v9

trans-unit.source: PHP INI setting magic_quotes_gpc "On" is deprecated since PHP 5.3. You are advised to set it to "Off" until it gets completely removed.
PHP INI setting safe_mode "On" is deprecated since PHP 5.3 and is not supported by TYPO3 anymore.

Directories created by TYPO3 are configured to be world writable. Depending on your server configuration, this can be a security risk. It is usually better to configure the create mask to not allow writing to directories by "others". A sane default is often '2770' for $GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['SYS']['folderCreateMask']. This can be set in the install tool.

Files created by TYPO3 are configured to be world writable. Depending on your server configuration, this can be a security risk. It is usually better to configure the create mask to not allow writing to files by "others". A sane default is often '0660' for $GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['SYS']['fileCreateMask']. This can be set in the install tool.
The Install Tool is temporarily enabled. Delete the file "%s" when you have finished setting up TYPO3. If not used the Install Tool will be disabled automatically in %s minutes.
These files are flagged as missing. Restore the files and run the indexer to reset the missing flag.
Checking database character set failed, got key "%1$s" instead of "character_set_database"
Your default database uses a different charset, but all tables uses utf-8. All good. But consider fixing your database collation and check the table creation settings.
Your default database uses utf-8. All good.
Your default database uses character set "%1$s", but only "utf8" or "utf8mb4" is supported with TYPO3.
Contact your system administrator or hosting provider for assistance with increasing your PHP memory limit.
Increase the memory limit by editing the memory_limit parameter in the file %s and then restart your web server (or contact your system administrator or hosting provider for assistance).
Depending on your configuration, TYPO3 can run with a %1$s PHP memory limit. However, a %2$s PHP memory limit or above is recommended, especially if your site uses additional extensions.
Depending on your configuration, TYPO3 can run with a %1$s PHP memory limit. However, a %2$s PHP memory limit or above is required especially if your site uses additional extensions.
You need to install and enable these modules to let TYPO3 function correctly.
The following PHP module(s) is/are missing: %s.
One or more modules are missing.
During a request %2$s of the memory limit was used. On %4$s a request to %5$s used %1$s of %3$s.
%s is enabled. TYPO3 requires this configuration directive to be disabled.
The PHP manual has instructions for %s.
Your site may not be secure when %s is enabled.
Your PHP installation is too old.
One or more problems were detected with your TYPO3 installation. Please check the status report for more information.
Get a status report about your site's operation and any detected problems.

Here you can find a short overview of your site's parameters as well as any problems detected with your installation. It may be useful to copy and paste this information into support requests filed on TYPO3's support mailinglists and project issue trackers.
During the configuration check of saltedpasswords the following issues have been found:
Some backend user passwords are found to be only md5 hashed. Run the scheduler task to convert all passwords to salted hashes.
Runs a system status check and sends notifications if problems have been found.
Always send notification mail (not only on errors or warnings)
Empty or invalid notification email address.
Empty or invalid notification email addresses.
For your Web Server some notifications have been found:

Fluid uses complex regular expressions which require a lot of stack space during the first processing. On Windows the default stack size for Apache is a lot smaller than on unix. You can increase the size to 8MB (default on unix) by adding to the httpd.conf:
<IfModule mpm_winnt_module>
ThreadStackSize 8388608
</IfModule>
Restart Apache after this change.

XCLASS can overwrite methods or classes of the core or other extensions. This is not necessarily a bad thing, but those XCLASS might break during extension or core upgrades. You should keep an eye on extension compatibility and make sure the intended functionality is still given after updates.
